name: Bit Crusher
short_description: Sample rate and bit depth reduction
description: This algorithm is an implementation of the disting mk4 algorithm of the same name. It applies sample rate and sample depth reduction to deliberately introduce quantisation and aliasing artefacts. It also optionally applies bitwise modification of the samples for non-linear distortion effects. There are two types of bit reduction available (Type I and Type II), and can be applied symmetrically or asymmetrically to positive and negative signal sections. Several bit mangling modes are also available.

params.name: Bit reduce
params.description: Sets the amount of bit reduction.

params.name: Symmetric
params.description: Chooses symmetric or asymmetric bit reduction.

params.name: Reduction
params.description: Sets the bit reduction type for positive and negative signals.

params.name: Downsample
params.description: Controls the downsampling (sample rate reduction), scaled at 0.8V/octave.

params.name: Input
params.description: The first input bus to process.

params.name: Width
params.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

params.name: Downsample input
params.description: The bus to use for the downsample CV, which is added to the Downsample parameter value. 0 = None.
